Package: org.weceem.services

[Groovy] Class WcmContentRepositoryService

    • org.weceem.services.WcmContentRepositoryService
    • All Implemented Interfaces and Traits:
      org.springframework.beans.factory.InitializingBean

      class WcmContentRepositoryService

      WcmContentRepositoryService class provides methods for WcmContent Repository tree manipulations. The service deals with WcmContent and subclasses of WcmContent classes.

      Authors:
      Sergei Shushkevich

          private groovy.lang.Closure criteriaWithParams(java.util.Map params, groovy.lang.Closure originalCriteria)
          Change a criteria closure so that it includes the restrictions specified in the params as per normal grails controller mechanisms - max, offset, sort and order
          private java.lang.Object criteriaWithStatus(java.lang.Object status, groovy.lang.Closure originalCriteria)
          Wrap a criteria query, adding filtering by status where status can be: - null for 'any' - a WcmStatus instance eg WcmStatus.get(1) - an integer for a status code eg 500 - a list of status codes eg [100, 200, 500] - a range of integer status codes eg (1..500) - a string integer status code eg "500"
          void deleteLink(WcmContent child, WcmContent parent)
          Deletes content reference
          void deleteNode(WcmContent sourceContent, boolean deleteChildren = false)

          void deleteNodes(java.util.List<WcmContent> nodesToDelete, boolean deleteChildren = false)
          Delete multiple nodes at once, avoiding problems where parent is deleted before descendents If you try to delete X and X/P/Z, you have to do it in the right order and don't bother deleting children if already deleted.

        • java.lang.Object calculateDayStartEndDates(java.lang.Object day, java.lang.Object month, java.lang.Object year)

          Calculates start and end timestamps for first and last second in given day, month and year, returning object containing: start - Date of 00:00:00 at start of the day end - Date of 23:59:59 at end of the day

          Parameters:
          day - Number in range 1-31
          month - Number in range 1-12
          year - Number

        • java.lang.Object calculateMonthStartEndDates(java.lang.Object month, java.lang.Object year)

          Calculates start and end timestamps for first and last second in given month and year, returning object containing: start - Date of 00:00:00 at start of month end - Date of 23:59:59 at end of month

          Parameters:
          month - Number in range 1-12
          year - Number

        • void checkDomainModel()

        • boolean contentIsRenderable(WcmContent content)

          Determine if the content node is able to be rendered to visitors.

          Returns:
          false if this content is not meant to be rendered, and is instead a component of other content

        • boolean contentMatchesStatus(java.lang.Object status, WcmContent node)

          Returns true if the node has a status that matches the supplied status See findWithStatus() for rules and possible values of "status"

        • java.lang.Object countChildren(WcmContent sourceNode, java.util.Map args = null)

          Count child nodes of a given node, where nodes match the type and status (if any) supplied in args Very useful for rendering the number of published comments on an item, for example in blogs.

        • private java.lang.Object criteriaWithStatus(java.lang.Object status, groovy.lang.Closure originalCriteria)

          Wrap a criteria query, adding filtering by status where status can be: - null for 'any' - a WcmStatus instance eg WcmStatus.get(1) - an integer for a status code eg 500 - a list of status codes eg [100, 200, 500] - a range of integer status codes eg (1..500) - a string integer status code eg "500"

        • void deleteNode(WcmContent sourceContent, boolean deleteChildren = false)

          Deletes content node and all it's references. All children of sourceContent will be assigned to all its parents.

          Parameters:
          sourceContent

        • void deleteNodes(java.util.List<WcmContent> nodesToDelete, boolean deleteChildren = false)

          Delete multiple nodes at once, avoiding problems where parent is deleted before descendents If you try to delete X and X/P/Z, you have to do it in the right order and don't bother deleting children if already deleted.

          todo:
          we can probably improve performance by applying the typeRestriction using some HQL

        • java.lang.Object findContentForPath(java.lang.String uriPath, WcmSpace space, boolean useCache = true, java.lang.String status = null)

          Find the content node that is identified by the specified uri path. This always finds a single WcmContent node or none at all. Each node can have multiple URI paths, so this code returns the node AND the uri to its parent so that you can tell where it is in the hierarchy This call does NOT filter by path.

          Parameters:
          uriPath
          space
          Returns:
          a map of 'content' (the node), 'lineage' (list of parent WcmContent nodes to reach the node) and 'parentURI' (the uri to the parent of this instance of the node)

        • java.lang.Object findContentForTimePeriod(java.lang.Object parentOrSpace, java.lang.Object startDate, java.lang.Object endDate, java.lang.Object args = [:])

          Get all the content within a given time period, inclusive at both ends

        • java.lang.Object findMonthsWithContent(java.lang.Object parentOrSpace, java.lang.Object contentType)

        • ContentReference[] findReferencesTo(WcmContent content)

          Use introspection to find all references to the specified content. Requires finding all associations/relationships to other WcmContent and querying them all individually. Hideous but less ugly than forcing all references to be ContentRef(s) we decided.

        • boolean isReferred(WcmContent content, java.util.List<WcmContent> contentList)

          Checks if a content item is referenced by some other content item in a list.

          Parameters:
          content - the item to check
          contentList - the list of items within which we search for referers
          Returns:
          true, iff the item is referenced by some other content item in the list

        • java.util.Map resolveSpaceAndURI(java.lang.String uri)

          Take a URI and work out what space it refers to, and what the remaining URI is Note, this is perhaps one of our most evil pieces of logic. Enter at your peril.

          Returns:
          A map with "space" and "uri" values, with the space resolved to a WcmSpace and uri amended

        • java.lang.Object triggerEvent(WcmContent content, EventMethod event, java.lang.Object arguments = null)

        • protected java.lang.Object withPermissionsBypass(groovy.lang.Closure code)

          Run all repo service methods inside the closure without any permissions checks. Inherently dangerous but needed to build up correct fingerprint and dependency info.
